diff --git a/.project-roadmap/issues-db/upstream/1008.json b/.project-roadmap/issues-db/upstream/1008.json
index b9255d57c..fd56665ce 100644
--- a/.project-roadmap/issues-db/upstream/1008.json
+++ b/.project-roadmap/issues-db/upstream/1008.json
@@ -12,12 +12,19 @@
   "created_at": "2018-06-25T01:42:29Z",
   "github_updated_at": "2021-06-28T12:10:34Z",
   "body_snippet": "I love SmartSize. I come form using a VNC client where I scaled the remote to 80% so I can see it all on my client screen. I can't see a scale option in mRemoteNG, but I do see SmartSize and it does the job for me, in that I can see the whole of both remote screens. I have two problems with it:\r\n\r\n1) It doesn't preserve the aspect ratio, which well, is handy for quick checks on stuff, but not a working mode for me.\r\n\r\n2) Because it forces a larger net workspace (on my report machine) into a smal...",
-  "our_status": "new",
-  "priority": null,
+  "our_status": "triaged",
+  "priority": "P3-enhancement",
   "target_release": null,
   "our_branch": null,
   "our_pr": null,
-  "iterations": [],
+  "iterations": [
+    {
+      "seq": 1,
+      "date": "2026-02-17",
+      "type": "triaged",
+      "description": "The 'Aspect' option for SmartSize is defined in the VNC enum but not implemented in the protocol logic; it requires handling container resizing to maintain the aspect ratio."
+    }
+  ],
   "comments": [
     {
       "id": "MDEyOklzc3VlQ29tbWVudDUzNjM0MjIzMA==",
@@ -34,5 +41,5 @@
   "needs_action": true,
   "waiting_for_us": true,
   "last_synced": "2026-02-15T09:52:50Z",
-  "notes": ""
+  "notes": "AI triage (gemini): The 'Aspect' option for SmartSize is defined in the VNC enum but not implemented in the protocol logic; it requires handling container resizing to maintain the aspect ratio.\nApproach: Implement logic in ProtocolVNC.cs to handle the 'SmartSAspect' mode by listening to the container's Resize event. Calculate the optimal dimensions for the VNC control to fit within the container while preserving the aspect ratio, and center it. Update ConnectionWindow.cs if necessary to enable the SmartSize toggle for VNC."
 }
